Who are two stakeholders that you think are important? Why do you think they are important?

Today's Activity: Stakeholder Profile and Community Research

Before you can design a solution, you have to understand your stakeholders and what their needs are. If you don't understand stakeholder need, you may design a solution that people don't need or don't use. To begin exploring stakeholder need, engineering design professionals reflect on what they already know, what they want to learn, and what biases they might hold that would keep them from truly understanding stakeholder need.

In this lesson, we'll learn more about stakeholder need through two activities. First, we'll make a stakeholder profile to document what we already know about stakeholders and what we would like to learn. Second, we will explore water conservation solutions in your community and consider how they meet stakeholder need. Along the way, we'll note any questions we have, any ideas that might be biased, and other information we would like to gather in the future.
